item.title: Opening Keynote:​ A Courageous Leap of Career Faith (UL)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded:
“1 of 5 Women Changing the World of VC/Entrepreneurship” – Forbes “25 Smartest Women On Twitter” – Fast Company “100 Most Influential Tech Women On Twitter” – Business Insider “6 Inspirational Women In Tech” – CraigConnects “100 NYC Tech Influencers You Need To Know” - AlleyWatch
If you asked Kelly Hoey in 2009 if she believed any of these descriptions would be used to describe her within the next five years, she would have replied, "are you kidding me?" Fall of 2009 was a pivotal time in Kelly's career transformation. It was the moment when she ​was inspired to ​stop playing it safe and used her courage to change everything by accepting an opportunity with many unknowns. So how ​can you prepare for career opportunity? Learn how​ ​a nice girl from Victoria, British Columbia, land​ed​ in New York City as an angel investor, board member​, ​​trusted advisor to hot tech startup​s​​ (​after a c​orporate detour through Toronto as a bankruptcy attorney)​ by developing her networks, ​cultivating ​diverse professional relationships,​ building​ a Yes Me Fund and ​finally, taking that ​courageous leap of ​career ​faith.

item.title: Big Data - How Big is it in Your Future? (F1)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: What is all of the hype about big data and what is it anyway? Attend this session to hear from three experts in the field who will define big data and its many facets, as well as the many challenges it presents. These women will tell you about their experiences with big data and their career paths in this fast growing area of technology. Following their presentations will be a Q&A session so you can learn more about this exciting field and how it can play a big part in your future.

item.title: Track Sponsor THINKGEEK: Closing the Confidence Gap: How to Sell Yourself by Building a Digital Brand (UL)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: Whether you're growing your business, polishing your resume, just entering or re-entering the workforce, you need to think about your digital brand. Learn how to make social media networks from LinkedIn to Twitter to Pinterest work for you, how to develop a content strategy that can help establish you as a thought leader, and how to avoid landmines and trip wires while doing it. Cecily Kellogg's decade of living her life publicly online can be both an example and a warning in this session dedicated to building your personal brand.

item.title: Mapping the Future: A Primer in Visualizing and Analyzing Open Data
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: More and more government agencies across the world are publishing data. This information is a valuable asset that can help citizens engage with their government, lead to new findings in research, and even spur business opportunities. But where do you find open data, and what can you do with it once it is obtained? This workshop will introduce participants to open data and applications for mapping and analyzing spatial data sets. Requirements: You will need a computer in order to get the most out of this workshop.

item.title: Javascript for Beginners (F2)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: JavaScript is the world's most popular programming language for a reason -- it's the primary way to build interaction on the web. Learning JavaScript is a logical next step once you've learned HTML/CSS. Many programming courses gloss over some of the tricky words like 'variable,' 'object,' and 'method.' This workshop is especially designed for beginners who are new to programming concepts and want to learn to begin programming with JavaScript. If those words are confusing to you now, no worries! You're exactly who we want to teach. In this class, we will be covering: basic development concepts, JavaScript, dynamic HTML, and we will touch on the jQuery library. Requirements: You will need a computer and familiarity with HTML to get the most out of this workshop. This course is specifically for beginners; experienced developers should not take this workshop.

item.title: Session Networking & Ask the Experts (UL & OL)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded:
Mobile Development

Audrey Troutt is eager to talk to you about app development for iOS and Android from where to begin to long term support and maintenance, whether you are working on an app alone or with a team of professionals. If you want to see her smile ask about automated testing and continuous integration for mobile apps.

Defending your fortress

Ashley Holtz will address your security questions, discuss how to break into the field, identify risk areas, and guide you to helpful resources to batten down your hatches and fight evil.

Closing Speaker Preview

Renee Chenault-Fattah will preview the conversation from her closing speech on realizing your dreams. Please join her with any questions you have on navigating and going forward in your career or if you want to share more about your career journey.

item.title: Mapping the Future: A Primer in Visualizing and Analyzing Open Data
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: More and more government agencies across the world are publishing data. This information is a valuable asset that can help citizens engage with their government, lead to new findings in research, and even spur business opportunities. But where do you find open data, and what can you do with it once it is obtained? This workshop will introduce participants to open data and applications for mapping and analyzing spatial data sets. Requirements: You will need a computer in order to get the most out of this workshop.

item.title: Javascript for Beginners
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: JavaScript is the world's most popular programming language for a reason -- it's the primary way to build interaction on the web. Learning JavaScript is a logical next step once you've learned HTML/CSS. Many programming courses gloss over some of the tricky words like 'variable,' 'object,' and 'method.' This workshop is especially designed for beginners who are new to programming concepts and want to learn to begin programming with JavaScript. If those words are confusing to you now, no worries! You're exactly who we want to teach. In this class, we will be covering: basic development concepts, JavaScript, dynamic HTML, and we will touch on the jQuery library. Requirements: You will need a computer and familiarity with HTML to get the most out of this workshop. This course is specifically for beginners; experienced developers should not take this workshop.

item.title: Career Development: If You Don’t Ask, You Don’t Get (F2)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: Chances are you have been in situations where you were reluctant to ask for what you wanted. Whether it’s a promotion, a raise, fewer meetings, a hug, more feedback, more business, more vacation time, or simply a booth instead of a table – you have the power to make your life better, your business more productive, and your relationships more fulfilling…just by asking. In this workshop, we will discuss the reasons we don’t ask for what we want and specific techniques for making successful asks.

item.title: Lunch (UL & OL)
item.dc:creator: caraj

item.title: Programming Languages: Ruby vs. Java (F1)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: Java and Ruby: two well-known and popular languages in today's tech world. Interested in one or both? Learn the ins and outs of these two major programming languages, when to use each, and see some sample code.

item.title: Track Sponsor THINKGEEK:Act Like a Leader, Think Like a Business (UL)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: Reach beyond your personal limitations and create your own personal board of directors. In this session you will learn how to obtain mentors, sponsors, and engage with influential brands and organizations.

item.title: SMACSS: Design Patterns that Make Life Easier (G2)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: Have you ever asked yourself, "What should I name this class," "Should I use a class or ID here," "Should I ever use !important," or "How should I structure my css?" I know I do - regularly! SMACSS (Scalable and Modular Architecture for CSS) is a handy reference that answers of all of these questions and more. What is great about SMACSS is that it isn't rigid, meaning you can use all or some of the frameworks featured, because we all have wonderful minds that process design patterns differently. In this session, we will review, discuss, and learn to recognize patterns in our own code to make organization easier on us and our teammates. Requirements: You will need familiarity with HTML and CSS and a computer with Chrome or Firefox to get the most out of this workshop.

item.title: Easy Ways to Make Your Sites More Accessible
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: View Presentation Slides In this workshop, we will explore the importance of making your sites and web apps accessible. The workshop will dive into some of the simplest fixes that wind up eliminating some of the most common accessibility issues. We will explore two Firefox browser add-ons that can help you make better choices about building your sites. Requirements: You will need knowledge of HTML, CSS, and a computer with Firefox installed in order to get the most out of this workshop.

item.title: Mobility - Changing the Course of Enterprise Communication (F1)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: Mobility generates faster response times from clients and coworkers alike. With improved communication, we are gaining valuable real-time analytics, which companies are now able to collect and share through the web and mobile apps, enhancing visibility and expediting decision making across all verticals. The panelists in this session will address the importance of user experience in mobility, how to acquire and retain users, and how they envision the future of connected devices in their fields.

item.title: Track Sponsor THINKGEEK: Negotiation: Crafting the Dialogue (UL)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: Negotiation is a critical business and life skill, whether you work in a large corporation, small firm, or are an entrepreneur. In fact, every transaction involves a negotiation; it is fundamental to achieving your goals. This session will outline negotiation theory, approaches, and techniques. The session will also use presentation, discussion, and examples from a number of negotiation scenarios to illustrate practical application. We will also discuss challenges that can arise during a negotiation, and provide effective methods to address them.

item.title: Introduction to Git: Take Chances with a Safety Net (G2)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded:
Version control is as essential to creating software as track changes is to document collaboration. Git is one of the most popular version control systems available, and repository sites like BitBucket and Github serve as online portfolios for many software engineers. Beyond just being an essential tool to collaborate and keep track of work, Git is also a great way to try new things without losing what you already have with powerful-yet-simple branching and merging capabilities. While it's an essential tool, it can be hard to get started. This workshop will introduce you to git, from installation all the way up to branching and working out of common problems. You'll learn how to:
  • Install Git
  • Set up a local repository and start committing changes
  • Clone a repository from Bitbucket or Github
  • Push your work to Bitbucket or Github
  • Branching: how to create different versions of your work
  • Merging: how to move your new code back into your working copy
  • Solve common problems with your repository
Requirements: You will need a computer in order to get the most out of this workshop. Get Started Now: To prepare for the workshop, you can follow the instructions to set up Git on your computer in advance.

item.title: Practical SVG for The Web (F2)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: The benefits of using Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) are vast and exciting: scalability, DOM accessibility, searchability, accessible text and descriptions, strong browser support, plays well with CSS, amazing interactive abilities, and easy to edit effects. This workshop will look specifically at these benefits and how they pertain to a web designer’s workflow. Together we will go over the basics of SVG to develop a foundation, review some program options, walk through the structure of a document, bring an SVG to a site as an image, inline, and as a background image, and edit these graphics with CSS. If you aren't sure how to even get started with SVG then this is the workshop for you. We will wrap up this workshop by touching on some things to keeps in mind while working with SVG on the web (a head’s up on potential “gotchas!") and where to go moving forward with your newfound, overwhelming love of these graphics; animation! gradients! patterns! light source effects! Let’s take on this complex language and make it less intimidating through practical examples and exercises that you will find beneficial in your daily work. Requirements: You will need knowledge of HTML and CSS and a computer to get the most out of this class. Prior familiarity with CodePen is also recommended.

item.title: Closing Keynote: Realize That Dream - Make it Happen Now (UL)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: Renee Chenault-Fattah did not start her career as a successful news anchor for Philadelphia's NBC10. She didn't even start her career journey in journalism. Renee will share with you her "unconventional" career journey and the actions she took to realize her dream. Whether you are starting out, looking to pivot, or just want to get back into the workplace, Renee's story will inspire you to take that next step to making it happen.

item.title: Session Networking & Ask the Experts (UL & OL)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded:
Cloud Computing

Amanda Lange will discuss Cloud Computing. What are the different services offered in the Cloud? Come with questions about how you can move your business, web site, or app onto the cloud, or if you’re just curious about what cloud computing means for you.

Keynote Follow Up

Have more questions on how to take that courageous leap of faith in your own career? Please come continue the conversation with Kelly Hoey on how you can take that lead in your own career transformation.

Bringing Your Business Idea to Life

Joanne Lang will be available to answer your questions about moving from corporate to startup life, bootstrapping vs. venture capital funding, building your team, creating a minimal viable product, getting PR, and more.

item.title: Welcome (UL)
item.dc:creator: caraj

item.title: CyberSecurity - Are You at Risk? (F1)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: How do you protect yourself and your business in today's online world? Hear the stories of women whose job it is to protect against the cyber threats that now seem to be a part of our daily lives. They will discuss what the threats are and the approaches to cyber security that companies take, and what you can do to make cyber security a part of both your work and home life. Additionally, they will tell you how they "hacked" their way into this exciting field. The Q&A session that follows the presentation will allow you to discover the options this area offers for your future.

item.title: Track Sponsor THINKGEEK: Women Helping Women Thrive: How to Support Other Women at Any Level in Your Career (UL)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: There is an incredible power in women helping women. It’s believed one woman’s success can only lead to another woman’s success. Easier said than done. Many women can remember a time when no one helped them when they needed assistance the most. Others may feel there is only room for one woman at a time. The reality is women make up 50% of the U.S. workforce and we should begin to use that to our advantage! Today’s modern workplace is often complex with input coming from every direction. How can one navigate the roadmap to success with so many mixed messages? Isn’t it about time we begin to reject old stereotypes and for women to help each other succeed at every level? During this panel discussion, learn through the power of peer support, how to expand your professional network by including more women and help change the lives of others at any stage in your career.

item.title: Sublime Secrets: How to Speed Up Your Workflow in Sublime Text (G2)
item.dc:creator: caraj
item.content:encoded: Sublime Text is a great editor for veteran programmers and beginners alike. It has lots of little features to make your life easier. No matter how long you’ve been using Sublime Text, there’s a plethora of handy tools and tips that you might not know. Requirements: You will need a computer with Sublime Text installed in order to get the most out of this workshop.
